fields.headline: Life's a cheap beach
fields.bodyText: British holidaymakers are taking advantage of cut-price deals to the Caribbean following a downturn in bookings from the US market. Hoteliers are offering discounts or added value deals to entice European travellers to visit the Caribbean while the Americans stay closer to home after the terrorist attacks in the US. There are particularly good deals to destinations which rely heavily on the US market such as Jamaica and Barbados. Nigel Cleevely, UK managing director of the Caribbean all-inclusive specialist Sandals, said it was the first time it had discounted its holidays. Discounts of up to £600 per person are available to resorts in Jamaica, St Lucia and Barbados. The offers even cover the Christmas holiday period. David Kevan, product manager at Tropical Locations, said many hoteliers were offering room upgrades or free nights. 'Not many upmarket hotels are discounting but the added value deals offer great value for money,' he said. Caribtours said business was beginning to pick up from the UK as travellers perceive the destination to be safe. 'Compared to Florida, Dubai or the Far East people view the Caribbean as very much in the comfort zone. There are no obvious religious or political affiliations,' said Caribtours managing director Catherine Leech. · Caribtours (020 7751 0660) is offering a 14-night stay at the Round Hill hotel in Jamaica for £1,134 per person for stays up to mid-December, a saving of £595. Room-only accommodation and flights are included. · Save up to £504 on a 14-night stay at the all-inclusive Sandals Ochos Rios resort (08701 626030), which now leads in at £1,699 per person. Bookings must be made before 31 December and the holiday can be taken up to 31 December, 2002. · Tropical Locations (020 7724 6644) is offering a free upgrade to a whirlpool beach suite, worth £140 per person, at the Spice Island resort in Grenada. A one-week all-inclusive holiday costs £1,977 per person including flights. · Kuoni (01306 747 000) is offering 14 nights at the all-inclusive Beaches resort in Turks & Caicos for £1,359 per person, a saving of £439. Departures are on 9 December from Heathrow and the offer is based on two people sharing. · Save £250 per person on a two-week holiday in the Dominican Republic with Thomson Direct (0870 550 2399). The stay at the Caribbean Village Club on the Green now costs £745 per person for departures on 7 January from Gatwick.
